review_title: DO NOT WORK FOR THIS COMPANY
pros: Taking care of sick people and helping them get better and other than that there is nothing good about this company
cons: Management is awful! They do not value their employees opinion. If you give your opinion you will have a target on your back. They pick one person and pick on them until they either quit or let you go. No matter if you are on good terms or not you will be marked as non rehired. Management follows girls around and spy’s on people and when you get up from your desk they want to know why you are up and what you are doing. You will be punished if you spend to long in the bathroom. I highly recommend not working for this company. The stress and anxiety is not worth it!

review_title: One of the best jobs of it's kind - but isn't perfect.
job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Findlay, OH
pros: The pay is probably the best in the entire facility for not requiring a degree, it is well-deserved though, as we're held very accountable for everything we do.  Annual raises are given.  Friendly group to work with.
cons:
There is no career ladder.  
Once a Patient Access Specialist (registration), always a Patient Access Specialist.  There are no team-leader, management, or higher positions to earn.  
The only "promotion" you may look forward to is receiving a full-time status position, but that will take years.  Those with full-time positions are not going anywhere, and if they do, the other full-time associates will take those jobs first, just to get a job that starts an hour earlier, leaving only the worst part time job open.  
You will always start out as a TOC (per diem, contingent, PRN) or Casual, and those associates are not required, but expected to be available and work 40-hours per week, pick up holidays, weekends, and night shifts, yet receive no benefits, no vacation, no insurance, and 1/4 of the occurrences (warnings) of an associate who works the same number of hours, but has a full-time status.

review_title: Things Aren't Perfect, But Management is Truly Striving for Continuous Improvement, Service Excellence
pros: Relationships with close co-workers, service excellence (customer service) is a key focus across the organization, good to above average benefits, fair pay ranges, senior management really wants to "do the right thing" and take care of their employees and patients
cons: Negativity can easily spread through the organization, middle management isn't always consistent with administering fair employee practices

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Findlay, OH
pros: Helping sick patients, patient interaction
cons: Management does not value employees opinions, if you try to provide feedback you are ostracized. If management doesn't like you, they are allowed to put "not rehirable" when you leave---no reason necessary. This has happened to MANY employees.

review_title: Toxic work environment/Not enough tools to complete job
pros: Good benefits, large facility, lots of transfer options
cons: Too many chiefs not enough Indians. Management does not listen to safety concerns for surgery patients. All about RVUs. When taking concerns to HR about surgeons skipping corners you will be the one to lose your job
